channel.title: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)
channel.description:
[/size][/size] Love Black Mesa: Source? Love Opposing Force? Well this mod is just for you this mod recreates Opposing Force with the Black Mesa assets, It has similar goals to Black Mesa Insecurity.[/size] [/size]
[b][font='Tahoma, Geneva, sans-serif']We currently working on this mod.[/font][/size][/b] [b][/size][/b] [b]Mod Developer: [url='https://forums.blackmesasource.com/index.php/User/58403-X-RaY/']X RaY[/url] [[url]https://www.moddb.com/members/byxray[/url]][/size][/b] [b][/size][/b] [b]Moddb Page: [url]https://www.moddb.com/mods/black-mesa-opposing-force[/url][/size][/b] [b][/size][/b] [b][font='Verdana, Geneva, sans-serif']We need a modeler to create Black Ops, New HECU Heads (Hecu medic,torc soldier,etc..), HECU zombie (remaked) and Race-X Aliens models [b][font='Verdana, Geneva, sans-serif']for mod[/font][/size][/b] [/font][/size] [b][font='Verdana, Geneva, sans-serif'][/font][/size][/b] [b][font='Verdana, Geneva, sans-serif']and we need experienced mappers at source and Black Mesa Game. If you have a experience of mapping,modeling, pm we for join to team![/font][/size][/b] [b][font='Verdana, Geneva, sans-serif'][/font][/size][/b] [b][font='Verdana, Geneva, sans-serif']ALERT: If you wanna enter you should have steam and moddb account.[/font][/size][/b] [b][font='Verdana, Geneva, sans-serif'][/font][/size][/b] [b][font='Verdana, Geneva, sans-serif'][url]https://www.moddb.com/company/black-mesa-opposing-force-dev-team[/url][/font][/size][/b] [b][font='Verdana, Geneva, sans-serif'][/font][/size][/b][b][/size][/b]
[b]=[/size][/b] Pictures = // Media Release #1[/size] [b]____________________________[/size][/b]

item.title: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)
item.dc:creator: Matt_the_Czar
item.description:
I really like what this is so far. Nice modeling and lighting. Will the chopper part of the game stay a brush based level? The interior of the Osprey model is pretty lo res, but looks better imo. Then again, it may interfere with the view of the manta blowing up aircraft. I’ll take a look in the model viewer.

EDIT: Looks pretty good IMO. Needs some rescaling to give that poor sargeant some headroom, but the model isn’t as bad as I thought. I’ll try to make a more higher res texture for the interior.

744×583

746×573

Read full topic

And Hammer for Black Mesa is under steam/steamapps/common/Black Mesa/bin - so if you have Black Mesa, you already have it installed.

item.title: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)
item.dc:creator: Ikkosen
item.description:
Yeah, I think this would be a great mod. I also had the same thing in mind but I never knew that somebody already had the idea and posted it already.

I also wanted to join in the team but I have problems and I don’t think i can work as a level designer here since I don’t have Hammer Editor or SDK 2013 but I really wanted to join here.
btw, I could join in as a level designer, concept artist or in choreography if you want. :thumbup:

Read full topic

item.source: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)

item.title: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)
item.dc:creator: Merrick_Simms
item.description:
I generally agree with this point of view but if in the past I was in joy about all the mod projects for Half-Life 2 there were, today I’m a little sad when I remembered how much of them were never finished.
For exemple, all these projects to creating a Blue Shift 2, an Opposing Forces 2 or the three remakes project for Half-Life : Uplink (four with Black Mesa : Uplink now). They were never finished but perhaps some of them would have been, if they had worked together.

Beside, it’s a fact now that the Half-Life community is sleeping. When you know that the community today has - for the most part - moved on others engine, it’s hard to know (for me at least) if it’s a good idea to make the same choices.

Bah… we will be fixed soon enough.

Read full topic
item.source: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)

item.title: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)
item.dc:creator: FRAG
item.description:
Totally agree with Crypt, we are not in a race with anyone, the more content for the masses the better, we work on OBM & GD and there are folk out there creating their own versions thanks to the release of Black Mesa, it’s a beautiful thing so let’s not ruin it with competition.

I’m seeing the same problem here though as others have, working with the OpFor timeline indeed means new assets are needed to complete the mod, you can only take brush work so far, then it becomes an issue.

And all the extra “lore” content would need to be created too, relying on BM models is great for a base but OpFor added in more stuff to achieve it’s storyline regarding Race X and other areas of the facility, also team based areas with your squad members, that is a big part too that can’t be missed, it is imperative that this mod takes a proactive approach to addressing these topics if it plans to actually achieve anything.

Read full topic
item.source: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)

item.title: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Firstly, I just wanna say fuck all that “compete w/ OBM” noise, we’re all modders and just wanna have fun. No need to bring competition into things.

Secondly, leaning or just expansion of the team could help remedy those issues, but that doesn’t resolve the entirely new ones that lie on the programming front. I think this team either hasn’t thought things through, or will have to cut a lot of OFs unique ideas and content out.

Read full topic

Make your own assets or at lease make part of them,like Gearbox did it in Opposing Force.How do you plan to make the race X?or simple things like ropes,engineer models?BALACLAVAS?You have a lot of work to do and it will be hard to compete with operation black mesa.

item.title: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Don’t see why you’d want to anyway, all the fun of modding and game dev in general is making things your own. Taking others work not only makes you look shitty but takes away that fun.

Read full topic
item.source: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)

item.title: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)
item.dc:creator: TextFAMGUY1
item.description:
Plus, as a modding team - make your own assets. This won’t survive as an actual project if you’re incapable of creating your own assets and have to resort to taking Gmod ones or ones from other games. Just don’t do it. Make your own stuff, and if you can’t, put together a team that can.

That is, if you’re interested in actually being quality. Which I’m dubious about, at the moment, given one of your screenshots was a brushwork Osprey interior, and given the presently shown attitude towards the community.

And yeah, as Brian said, if we sniff out any potential IP/copyright issues, we’ll take that shit down ourselves. We’ve already had enough trouble on that front, we’re not going near another mess like that.

Read full topic
item.source: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)

item.title: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)
item.dc:creator: bkdale86
item.description:
No. Not just no hell no. You do realize that that is stolen from COD ghosts? If something like that was included it would get us sued and at a minimum will get us a cease and desist. We have already had at least one complaint from people uploading things to the workshop that were copyrighted. Don’t ever suggest something like this again. IF this is added as a workshop item it will all be removed.

Read full topic
item.source: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)

item.source: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)

item.title: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)
item.dc:creator: Rock5371
item.description:
TextFAMGUY1:

Also, I just wanted to add - that brushwork Osprey interior is glorious. One thing we’ve learned the hard way recently with our tribulations on Xen and our recent new earthbound stuff - stay away from using brushwork for basically anything, when you can. There’s about a million reasons why you shouldn’t, but the most important one - it always looks horrible. If you want to create a professional and good looking piece of work, you need modellers. Model your details. You need to get modellers and mappers working in very close proximity, trading things back and forth, if you want to get good results.

Indeed, use models, they are very useful if you’re going to make a Black Mesa related mod. Now if you want to use models for the intro you’ll obviously use the Osprey-V22 model, it already has an interior and chairs there as well, which you can use without needing to map the interior, but it does need modifying like adding windows, textures, etc.

Read full topic
item.source: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)

item.title: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)
item.dc:creator: TextFAMGUY1
item.description:
I’m not exactly sure what’s going on in this thread, or what this is even really meant to be.

But…let’s not get hostile to people who are suggesting ideas. “We don’t take ideas” seems like a totally counterintuitive statement, given that this entire project is literally taking someone else’s idea and remaking it. And there’s nothing wrong with that, Black Mesa is the same. That’s what a remake is. You won’t get far if you don’t build off the community.

Also, I just wanted to add - that brushwork Osprey interior is glorious. One thing we’ve learned the hard way recently with our tribulations on Xen and our recent new earthbound stuff - stay away from using brushwork for basically anything, when you can. There’s about a million reasons why you shouldn’t, but the most important one - it always looks horrible. If you want to create a professional and good looking piece of work, you need modellers. Model your details. You need to get modellers and mappers working in very close proximity, trading things back and forth, if you want to get good results. It’s been a big struggle that we’ve been dealing with for Xen.

To lighten things up a bit in here, here’s a brushwork truck. Literally taken from HL1, from an original Bootcamp VMF.

Brushwork Truck.JPG1661×901 48 KB

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)
item.dc:creator: Black_Priest
item.description:
Rayzen:

I downloaded Black Mesa travel , I put the folder name ‘‘mod’’ in Steam/steamapps/common/Black Mesa/bms/maps but I don’t know why isn’t work.

I wrote map bm_c0a0 in console (it’s inbound chapter) , after I wrote and ‘‘map bm_c0a0b’’ and ‘‘map bm_c0a0c’’ it’s same chapter

Who can help me with Black Mesa Travel mod ?

You have activated the password using the code sv_cheats 1? To run need original files to replace those who download (the original files to save don’t be in a different place) to do it all in the maps folder. I still get to run even via the game menu, select the first Chapter

Read full topic

If others will have the same error, I will think what to do. I just have it present, and how to fix that which is not. In any case I will try to find out why this error generally appears

item.title: Black Mesa: Opposing Force (Half-Life: Opposing Force Remake)
item.dc:creator: danielko
item.description:
Black Priest:

Hello everyone, I have been informed that the work is made by me you lit up I Decided to go and look. If anyone have questions, write here or in steam, I am there under the name blackpriest007. https://www.playground.ru/files/black_mesa/ BM Travel

Hey welcome to the Black Mesa Forums!

BM Travel looks cool, and I think it’d be a good idea to rename your first three maps and publish them to the Steam Workshop to spread them out in the wild

UPDATE: Black Mesa failed to load your second map, and re-downloaded the original one.

UPDATE 2: When trying to load the map manually, Black Mesa crashed with this message:

"---------------------------
Engine Error

MapEntity_ParseAllEntities: found e when expecting {

OK

"

Read full topic
